040/**
041 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
042 * @author WB
043 *
044 */
045public abstract class IjUtils {
046        
047        private IjUtils() {}
048        
049        /**
050         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
051         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
052         * 
053         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
054         * @return an array of currently open images.
055         */
056        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
057                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
058        }
059        
060
061        /**
062         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
063         * of the images supplied.
064         * 
065         * @param images array of images.
066         * @return array of names.
067         */
068        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
069                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
070                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
071                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
072                }
073                return imageNames;
074        }
075        
076        /**
077         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
078         * @param title string to show in the dialog
079         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
080         */
081        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
082                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
083                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
084                if (title == null) {
085                        title = "image:";
086                }
087                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
088                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
089                gd.showDialog(); 
090                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
091                        return null;
092                else {
093                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
094                }
095        }
096        
097        
098        /**
099         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
100         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
101         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
102         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
103         * 
104         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
105         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
106         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
107         */
108        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
109                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
110                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
111        if (wList != null) {
112                for (int i : wList) {
113                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
114                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
115                        imgList.add(imp);
116                    }
117                }
118        }
119        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
120        if (sortByTitle) {
121                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
122                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
123                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
124                        }
125                };
126                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
127        }
128                return impArr;
129        }
130        
131
132        /**
133         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
134         *  
135         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
136         * @return path of the selected resource.
137         */
138        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
139                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
140                String dir = od.getDirectory();
141                String name = od.getFileName();
142                if (name == null)
143                        return null;
144                return encodeURL(dir + name);
145        }
146        
147        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
148                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
149                url = url.replace('\\','/');
150                return url;
151        }
152        
153        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
154        
155
156        /**
157         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
158         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
159         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
160         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
161         * 
162         * @param title image title
163         * @param M 2D array
164         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
165         */
166        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
167                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
168                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
169                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
170                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
171                        }
172                }
173                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
174        }
175        
176
177        /**
178         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
179         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
180         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
181         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
182         * 
183         * @param title the image title
184         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
185         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
186         */
187        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
188                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
189                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
190                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
191                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
192                        }
193                }
194                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
195        }
196        
197        /**
198         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
199         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
200         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
201         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
202         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
203         * 
204         * @param ip The affected image
205         */
206        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
207                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
212         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
213         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
214         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
215         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
216         * 
217         * @param ip The affected image
218         * @param wr Red weight
219         * @param wg Green weight
220         * @param wb Blue weight
221         */
222        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
223                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
224                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
225                }
226        }
227        
228        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
229        
230        /** 
231         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
232         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
233         * @param fp the image
234         * @return the resulting array
235         */
236        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
237                final int width = fp.getWidth();
238                final int height = fp.getHeight();
239                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
240                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
241                int i = 0;
242                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
243                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
244                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
245                                i++;
246                        }
247                }
248                return dPixels;
249        }
250        
251        /**
252         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
253         * from the given {@code double[][]} with dimensions 
254         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
255         * 
256         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
257         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
258         */
259        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
260                final int width = A.length;
261                final int height = A[0].length;
262                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
263                int i = 0;
264                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
265                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
266                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
267                                i++;
268                        }
269                }
270                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
271        }
272        
273        /**
274         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
275         * from the given {@code float[][]} with dimensions 
276         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
277         * 
278         * @param A a 2D {@code float} array
279         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
280         */
281        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
282//              final int width = A.length;
283//              final int height = A[0].length;
284//              float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
285//              int i = 0;
286//              for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
287//                      for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
288//                              fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
289//                              i++;
290//                      }
291//              }
292//              return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
293                return new FloatProcessor(A);
294        }
295        
296        /**
297         * Converts a {@link FloatProcessor} to a {@code float[][]}.
298         * @param fp a {@link FloatProcessor}
299         * @return the resulting {@code float[][]}
300         */
301        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
302//              final int w = fp.getWidth();
303//              final int h = fp.getHeight();
304//              float[][] A = new float[w][h];
305//              for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
306//                      for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
307//                              A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
308//                      }
309//              }
310//              return A;
311                return fp.getFloatArray();
312        }
313        
314        /**
315         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
316         * {@link ByteProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
317         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if they have
318         * been set (not null), otherwise ITU709 weights (see {@link RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights}) 
319         * are applied.
320         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
321         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
322         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
323         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
324         * 
325         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
326         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
327         * @see #toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
328         */
329        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
330                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
331                        return toByteProcessor(cp, null);
332                }
333                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
334                        return cp.convertToByteProcessor();
335                }
336        }
337        
338        /**
339         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
340         * {@link ByteProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
341         * The processor's individual weights (if set) are ignored.
342         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
343         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
344         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
345         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
346         * 
347         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
348         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
349         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
350         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
351         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
352         */
353        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
354                if (rgbWeights == null) {
355                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
356                }
357                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
358                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
359                }
360                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
361                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
362                ByteProcessor bp = cp.convertToByteProcessor();
363                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
364                return bp;
365        }
366        
367        /**
368         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
369         * {@link FloatProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
370         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if 
371         * set, otherweise default weights are used (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
372         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
373         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
374         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
375         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
376         * 
377         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
378         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
379         * @see #toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
380         */
381        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
382                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
383                        return toFloatProcessor(cp, null);
384                }
385                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
386                        return cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
387                }
388        }
389        
390        /**
391         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
392         * {@link FloatProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
393         * If {@code null} is passed for the weights, default weights are used
394         * (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
395         * The processor's individual weights (if set at all) are ignored.
396         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
397         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
398         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
399         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
400         * 
401         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
402         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
403         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
404         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
405         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
406         */
407        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
408                if (rgbWeights == null) {
409                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
410                }
411                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
412                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
413                }
414                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
415                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
416                FloatProcessor fp = cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
417                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
418                return fp;
419        }
420        
421        /**
422         * Creates and returns a new {@code ByteProcessor} from
423         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
424         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
425         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
426         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
427         * the height of the resulting image.
428         * 
429         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
430         * @return a new {@code ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
431         */
432        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
433                final int w = A.length;
434                final int h = A[0].length;
435                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
436                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
437                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
438                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
439                        }
440                }
441                return bp;
442        }
443        
444        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
445                final int w = bp.getWidth();
446                final int h = bp.getHeight();
447                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
448                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
449                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
450                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
451                        }
452                }
453                return A;
454        }
455        
456        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
457                final int w = A.length;
458                final int h = A[0].length;
459                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
460                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
461                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
462                                int val = A[u][v];
463                                if (val < 0)
464                                        val = 0;
465                                else if (val > 255) 
466                                        val = 255;
467                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
468                        }
469                }
470                return bp;
471        }
472        
473        /**
474         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it
475         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
476         * 
477         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
478         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
479         */
480        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
481                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
482                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
483        }
484        
485        
486        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
487        
488        /**
489         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
490         * 
491         * @param ip1 the first image
492         * @param ip2 the second image
493         * @return true if both images have the same type
494         */
495        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
496                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
497        }
498        
499        /**
500         * Checks if two images have the same size.
501         * 
502         * @param ip1 the first image
503         * @param ip2 the second image
504         * @return true if both images have the same size
505         */
506        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
507                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
508        }
509        
510        /**
511         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
512         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
513         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
514         * This should work for all image types.
515         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
516         * 
517         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
518         * @return true if the image is binary
519         */
520        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
521                final int width = ip.getWidth();
522                final int height = ip.getHeight();
523                int fgVal = 0;
524                boolean binary = true;
525                
526                outer:
527                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
528                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
529                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
530                                if (val != 0) {
531                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
532                                                fgVal = val;
533                                        }
534                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
535                                                binary = false;
536                                                break outer;
537                                        }
538                                }
539                        }
540                }
541                
542                return binary;
543        }
544        
545        /**
546         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
547         * the same value.
548         * This should work for all image types.
549         * 
550         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
551         * @return true if the image is flat
552         */
553        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
554                final int width = ip.getWidth();
555                final int height = ip.getHeight();
556                boolean flat = true;
557                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
558                
559                outer:
560                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
561                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
562                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
563                                if (val != fgVal) {
564                                        flat = false;
565                                        break outer;
566                                }
567                        }
568                }
569                
570                return flat;
571        }
572        
573        /**
574         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
575         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
576         * 
577         * @param ip an image (of any type)
578         * @return an array of 2D points
579         */
580        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
581                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
582                int M = ip.getWidth();
583                int N = ip.getHeight();
584                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
585                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
586                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
587                                if (val != 0) {
588                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
589                                }
590                        }
591                }
592                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
593        }
594        
595        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
596        
597        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
598        
599        /**
600         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
601         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
602         * 
603         * @param ip1 the first image
604         * @param ip2 the second image
605         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
606         */
607        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
608                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
609        }
610        
611        /**
612         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
613         * the specified tolerance). 
614         * 
615         * @param ip1 the first image
616         * @param ip2 the second image
617         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
618         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
619         */
620        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
621                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
622                        return false;
623                }
624                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
625                        return false;
626                }
627                
628                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
629                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
630                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
631                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
632                }
633                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
634                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
635                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
636                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
637                }
638                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
639                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
640                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
641                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
642                }
643                
644                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
645                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
646                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
647                        boolean same = true;
648                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
649                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
650                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
651                                        same = false;
652                                        break;
653                                }
654                        }
655                        return same;
656                }
657
658                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
659        }
660        
661        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
662        
663        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
664                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
665        }
666
667        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
668                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
669                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
670        }
671        
672        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
673                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
674                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
675                        if (p != null) {
676                                int u = p.getXint();
677                                int v = p.getYint();
678                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
679                        }
680                }
681        }
682        
683        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
684        
685        /**
686         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
687         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
688         * @return true if no exception was thrown
689         */
690        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
691                return run(pluginfilter, "");
692        }
693        
694        /**
695         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
696         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
697         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
698         * @return true if no exception was thrown
699         */
700        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
701                try {
702                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
703                } catch (Exception e) {
704                        return false;
705                }
706                return true;
707        }
708        
709        /**
710         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
711         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
712         * @return true if no exception was thrown
713         */
714        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
715                return run(plugin, "");
716        }
717        
718        /**
719         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
720         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
721         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
722         * @return true if no exception was thrown
723         */
724        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
725                try {
726                        plugin.run(arg);
727                } catch (Exception e) {
728                        return false;
729                }
730                return true;
731        }
732        
733        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
734        
735        /**
736         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument string.
737         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
738         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
739         * @return true if no exception was thrown
740         */
741        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
742                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
743        }
744        
745        /**
746         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class.
747         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)} instead.
748         * @param clazz class of the plugin
749         * @param arg argument string
750         * @return true if no exception was thrown
751         */
752        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
753                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
754                try {
755                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
756                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
757                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
758                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
759                }
760                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
761        }
762        
763        /**
764         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string.
765         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)} instead.
766         * @param clazz class of the plugin
767         * @return true if no exception was thrown
768         */
769        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
770                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
771        }
772        
773        /**
774         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class.
775         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
776         * @param clazz class of the plugin
777         * @param arg argument string
778         * @return true if no exception was thrown
779         */
780        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
781                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
782                try {
783                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
784                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
785                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
786                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
787                }
788                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
789        }
790
791}
